abstract.p: Europe's biggest hand-held computer maker Psion PLC plans public offering of Symbian Ltd, alliance it created with mobile phone makers to develop its operating system for wireless devices (S)

block.p: Europe's biggest hand-held computer maker, Psion P.L.C., said it planned a public offering of Symbian Ltd., an alliance Psion created with mobile phone makers to develop its operating system for wireless devices. Psion's partners are Ericsson of Sweden, Nokia of Finland, the Motorola Corporation and the Matsushita Electric Industrial Company of Japan. Psion said shares of Symbian, valued at up to $8 billion, would be sold once its software had begun to sell in volume.

Europe's biggest hand-held computer maker, Psion P.L.C., said it planned a public offering of Symbian Ltd., an alliance Psion created with mobile phone makers to develop its operating system for wireless devices. Psion said shares of Symbian, valued at up to $8 billion, would be sold once its software had begun to sell in volume.
